Penjual Bunga di Desa Cihideung, Tetap Bertahan dari Masa ke Masa
07 Nov 2019, 00:06 by Cecep Wijaya Sari
MEMASUKI Kawasan Agrowisata Desa Cihideung, Kecamatan Parongpong, Kabupaten Bandung Barat, suasana sekitar dipercantik dengan semarak bunga berwarna-warni. Beragam bunga potong dan hias berderet di sepanjang Jalan Terusan Sersan Bajuri itu.
Sekitar 80 persen warga Desa Cihideung memang merupakan petani bunga, di mana terdiri dari 30 persen petani bunga potong, dan 50 persen petani bunga hias. Berbagai bunga yang mereka tawarkan kerap menarik pengunjung dari berbagai daerah terutama pada akhir pekan. Tak heran, sebagian besar pemasukan mereka pun diperoleh dari hasil penjualan bunga.
Meski demikian, keberadaan wisata bunga di Desa Cihideung tidak mengalami perkembangan signifikan dari masa ke masa. Meski menjadi salah satu destinasi wisata, tidak ada lahan parkir yang luas untuk para pengunjung.
Kondisi itu mengakibatkan para pengunjung yang membawa kendaraan roda empat kesulitan memarkirkan kendaraan mereka. Akibatnya bahu jalan terpaksa dipakai untuk tempat parkir.
"Kalau untuk lahan parkir, saya sediakan sendiri karena kalau tidak, mobil diparkir di jalan," kata Tia Samanta (34) penjual bunga di Desa Cihideung, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Warga asli Desa Cihideung itu merintis usaha bunga hias bersama suaminya sejak 2004. Dari tahun ke tahun, usahanya mengalami pasang surut. Meski demikian, mereka tetap bertahan menggeluti usaha tersebut.
Menurut Tia, faktor cuaca cukup memengaruhi usaha bunga hias meski tidak begitu signifikan. "Kalau musim hujan biasanya memang tanaman lebih bagus, tapi pembeli sering banyak terkendala seperti kalau ada banjir di daerah lain. Itu cukup berpengaruh juga," katanya.
Penjual bunga lainnya, Ani Sumarni (41) mengungkapkan, penghasilannya saat ini dari penjualan bunga tidak menentu dan cenderung menurun. Ia memanfaatkan pekarangan rumahnya untuk menjajakanberbagai bunga hias dan potong.Â 
Harga bunga per polybag berkisar Rp 10.000-Rp 25.000. Meski banyak bunga yang ditawarkan, menurut dia, tak semua pengunjung tertarik untuk membelinya. "Sekarang tidak bisa ditentukan kapan ramai kapan sepi. Setiap bulan cenderung sama," ujarnya.
Berbeda dengan beberapa tahun lalu, dia menuturkan, pengunjung dari luar kota kerap memesan bunga ke tempatnya dalam jumlah besar. Pemesan bunga berasal dari Jakarta, Tangerang, Cirebon, dan sebagian daerah Jawa Tengah.
Ketua Gapoktan Bunga Hias Cihideung, Adil Hendra membenarkan, usaha penjualan bunga di Cihideung mengalami pasang surut. Bahkan, ada sebagian lahan di desa ini yang sekarang telah beralih fungsi menjadi bangunan.
Meski demikian, menurut dia, usaha bunga hias sekarang telah merambah ke desa-desa di sekitar Cihideung. Tren pembeli juga berubah dari yang semula kebanyakan untuk pribadi, sekarang justru untuk dijual kembali.
"Makanya pada hari-hari biasa, rata-rata pembeli yang datang itu dari luar daerah, seperti daerah Jawa Tengah dan Jawa Timur. Biasanya, itu untuk dijual kembali," katanya.***

Flower Sellers in Cihideung Village, Stay Persistent from Time to Time
Nov 7 2019, 00:06 by Cecep Wijaya Sari
ENTERING the Cihideung Village Agrotourism Area, Parongpong District, West Bandung Regency, the surrounding atmosphere is enhanced with colorful flowers. A variety of cut and ornamental flowers lined up along the Sergeant Bajuri Canal Road.
About 80 percent of the residents of Cihideung Village are indeed flower farmers, which consists of 30 percent cut flower farmers, and 50 percent decorative flower farmers. The various flowers they offer often attract visitors from various regions, especially on weekends. Not surprisingly, most of their income is also obtained from the sale of flowers.
However, the existence of flower tourism in Cihideung Village has not experienced significant development from time to time. Despite being a tourist destination, there is no large parking area for visitors.
This condition makes it difficult for visitors carrying four-wheeled vehicles to park their vehicles. As a result, the shoulder of the road had to be used as a parking lot.
"As for the parking lot, I provide it myself because if not, the car is parked on the road," said Tia Samanta (34) a flower seller in Cihideung Village, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
The native resident of Cihideung Village has pioneered decorative flower business with her husband since 2004. From year to year, her business has experienced ups and downs. However, they still survive in the business.
According to Tia, the weather factor influenced the decorative flower business even though it was not so significant. "When the rainy season is usually better plants, but buyers are often constrained as if there are floods in other areas. That is quite influential as well," he said.
Another flower seller, Ani Sumarni (41) said that her current income from the sale of flowers was uncertain and tended to decline. He used his yard to sell various decorative and cut flowers.
The price of flowers per polybag ranges from Rp 10,000 to Rp 25,000. Although a lot of interest is offered, according to him, not all visitors are interested in buying it. "Now it can't be determined when it's busy when it's quiet. Every month it tends to be the same," he said.
Unlike a few years ago, he said, visitors from outside the city often order flowers to the place in large numbers. Flower buyers come from Jakarta, Tangerang, Cirebon, and parts of Central Java.
Head of Gapoktan Bunga Hias Cihideung, Adil Hendra confirmed, the flower sales business in Cihideung experienced ups and downs. In fact, there is a portion of land in this village that has now been converted into a building.
However, according to him, the ornamental flower business has now expanded to villages around Cihideung. The buyer trend has also changed from being mostly private, now to resale.
"Therefore, on normal days, the average buyer who comes from outside the region, such as Central Java and East Java. Usually, it is for resale," he said. ***
